storyInfo: In a Taran district where tensions flare higher with each passing day, Reed takes it upon herself to save two refugees' lives.

attributes.content: Eight Years Ago
County Oak Grove
Your Lordship, more than a paucity are inquiring after you, wondering what our planned next move will be.
attributes.name: Witty Noble

attributes.content: Our repertoire has been a massive success, all thanks to your backing.
attributes.name: Witty Noble

attributes.content: The Tarans' own theater, and the Tarans' own history. Two hundred strong came to see the premiere, and my, were they overjoyed.
attributes.name: Witty Noble

attributes.content: Now, we can pursue joint partnership in a few factories on Baron McAneny's estate, or we can accept this offer of alliance with a number of bankers...
attributes.name: Witty Noble

attributes.content: Leave these topics for after the soirée, Sir Perth. Or have a typist make the arrangements in your stead, and they won't make much mess of it.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: We should talk tonight only of the freshly concluded performance, and of Taran culture. Forget all that Victorian long-windedness and flattery.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: Everyone, all this status and etiquette, this daintiness and diction, this respectable vocabulary we rely on to exchange thoughts, we were taught all of it by the Victorians.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: They're the same as the Victorians' machines, saddling the Tarans' hearts with contemporary ills.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: Time was we only knew our natural highness and valor, and the blood we inherit from King Gaeil would stir without rest at the call of battle...
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: But now, we've been trained in the Victorians' guile and vanity, to the point where faced with a true and genuine undertaking, a rally to an ideal, many can only play it as a game in their own interest.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: It is not solely us, either. It goes for the everyday Taran citizen we so often meet in the streets, too.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: Since being contaminated by Victorians' vice, they have become Oripathics, and become rascals, ruffians.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: Very well said, My Lord—
attributes.name: Witty Noble

attributes.content: —I'm sorry, I accidentally broke my wine glass.
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: It seems your glass wished to interject.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: I'd like to ask Your Lordship's opinion on something.
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: Pardon my memory, but who might you be...?
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: Williams, the bard. Writer of that play that happened tonight. But you don't need to go to the trouble of remembering my name; I can't say I've made much contribution to the literary circles.
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: Hardly, Mr. Williams. As I've said, I most detest the Victorians' long-windedness.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: Ask away.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: You've likened the Tarans to a diseased people. How should we heal ourselves in your view, then? How should we save fellow Tarans from the brink?
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: I fear no matter how hard we strive, we cannot cure the blight core to us, just as muddied water cannot clean itself.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: So you say it's beyond us to save them, the rascals, the ruffians.
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: You don't believe they simply lack for knowledge, education? That the power to help them lives in our pens?
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: *sigh* Too fine an intellect is exactly what our enemy is.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: Of course, we write, we rally, we dream of the ideal nation of Tara... We try to rouse the memories of it sleeping in our blood.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: But you and I will have to be the ones to stay behind in these olden days.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: You see, I very much enjoy your works. And yet, we're forced to use the Victorian language.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: 'I lay down now my soldier's honor here, so that in time the soil of Tara need no longer be soaked in carmine blood, and Draco cross no swords with Draco kin.'
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: 'Be that unless a day comes, whereupon Red Dragon's flame should lead all those that fell, our fighters from the forge to be reborn.'
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: As much as I'm flattered, it's all a simple record of the folk ballads. The most I did was add some metered polish.
attributes.name: Plain-Dressed Bard

attributes.content: No, I'm just thinking...
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: It's no sure thing that Tara will never have another Red Dragon.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: After all, none of us have ever seen a Draco before. How would we tell if whoever passes by us isn't actually a Vouivre?
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: Village of Redridge, Scáthanna Fields
Found them. It was these two mucking about in the streets. Sound of the window breaking must've been their doing.
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: Hey, settle down, you two, or else it's not your wrists the rope goes around next time.
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: *spit*!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Wait—come on, stop being vile now...!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I—I'm sorry! I'm sorry, officers! It was our fault!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Is that the wanted lot, the ones rubbing up with Dublinn?
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: One of them's wanted. The other I've never seen.
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: Heh, I knew these Tarans would all be in on it. Bloody good-for-nothings.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: Eek! Please don't do anything, I beg you...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: This is all we had on us, you searched us and all... Ask us anything you want, we'll explain, we will...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Shut up. What are your pals up to, eh? Where'd they go? Are they off gossiping info to Dublinn?
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: I—I don't know, honestly, I don't...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: We don't even have any pals! We've never met anyone from Dublinn before!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: And you just want some people to beat to death, give yourself something to report to your noble brass!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: *spit*! You... you bloody Victorian scumbags!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Keeping mum, are you?
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: Take them inside. Don't let these ballsacks make their racket on the street. They'll wake the rest of us up.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: Question the one with the bag first. If he's honest, he can suffer a little less.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: I—I'm honest, I'm an honest person, I swear, I don't know a thing...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Hold on, Captain.
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: I think there's more nearby.
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: Uh, the—there's...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: What's bag boy shouting about?
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: Fire!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Shut UP! Don't try and cover for your friends—
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: —No, but there's a fire off behind you!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: It's the warehouse!
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: Bloody Nora! I want the word out to Team 1! Prioritize firefighting!
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: Er, did they dump us and go?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Fionn, come on, undo my ropes here!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: H—How? I'm tied up too...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Who are you?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Let's go, quick.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: *huff* I'm sorry you had to run with us. You've got nothing to do with this...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...It's fine, we shook them off.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Hey, Fionn, the radio?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Right here. Should still be usable, just a little quiet.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Quiet's good. Keeps us from being found.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: *sigh* You listen for any word, I'll go wash my face at the pond. Try and calm down.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Excuse me, Vouivre. You can go if it's dangerous to you. I'll point you on your way.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: No need... I can wait here, and keep watch for you.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: ...Alright, thank you. You're a good one, truly.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: (Deep breath)
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: No nerves, Fionn, no nerves. Out of sight, out of mind.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: You didn't touch blood. It is not blood. It's just marshy mud. Wash it off and it'll be fine...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...Hfff.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: *sigh*.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Bollocks... hey! You swear this stupid thing still works?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Shush, god's sakes! Those army lot can't be far away!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Give it a few more knocks, then crank it!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...approximately 9:30 PM...
attributes.name: Voice on the Airwaves

attributes.content: There.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: A case of arson in a settlement close to the County Trent... methods resemble those of the Dublinn insurrectionists...
attributes.name: Voice on the Airwaves

attributes.content: ...the three suspected are still on the run...
attributes.name: Voice on the Airwaves

attributes.content: Should... clues on Dublinn elements not report them to the authorities... considered equally guilty as these rebels...
attributes.name: Voice on the Airwaves

attributes.content: ...warn you once again... the lights-out bell, you are not to go outside. All areas apart from mines and factories are forbidden from lighting any lamps whatsoever...
attributes.name: Voice on the Airwaves

attributes.content: Put a stop... all activities related to these insurgents...
attributes.name: Voice on the Airwaves

attributes.content: (White noise)
attributes.name: Voice on the Airwaves

attributes.content: Diabhal. They really broadcast nothing else past 9 PM.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: What are these bloody rules, in ainm Dé?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Sorry. That's a foul tongue for Taran. Could you understand that?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Yes... but that's fine.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: No, still, I'm sorry. For dragging an outsider like you into this.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: It's okay... Tarans are the same, no matter where they are.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I once visited the Scáthanna Fields, myself. But they didn't have rules about lights-out back then.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Ó, I'm guessing you're from a nomadic city, then?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Bell-ringing as law has been around for years. Used to just be out on the barrens, to mind whoever tried sneaking into whatever count or viscount's hunting grounds at dead midnight.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Bell rings, we snuff the lamps, and fires go out too. If someone in the barrens lights a fire to herd beasts at this hour, you can see it clear as day from miles and miles away.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: But muck-ups like today only happened once the new rules got stricter. Those night patrol tossers see anyone in the street, they snatch 'em.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: There, Fionn. Calmed down?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Suppose so...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...Er, where's our medicine? Are we all out?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Take a guess?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: ...*sigh*. Shame about my fountain pen. Can't even note my own debts now.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Stealing is what we're doing. Don't think you have to make up for it with what you've got.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: How many days have we been outdoors now?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: If it's not midnight yet, then it's day 12 for us.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Alright. Twelve days, and we've barely gotten far. I keep thinking if only it'd clear up, I might see chimney smoke or something from a village.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: We've just been hounded by the army, chased around in circles here...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Be honest, do you really think we can make it out?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...What happened with you two?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: We had a little confrontation with the patrol. They sent a warrant out for us.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Fionn!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Let me talk, Fergal. I can feel, this lady's a good person.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: When the patrol came here to make arrests, they summoned everyone who had a record. And then they started with the beatings, so we fought back...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: You didn't, Fionn. Don't give yourself credit.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Ugh, okay.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: We hadn't done all that bad, really, truth told. One family ran after they couldn't pay tax dues, so the patrol was dragging all their relatives in by the scruff for questioning. Fergal was brewing a little moonshine just for himself, and I'd missed some formalities while selling stuff.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: *sigh* We'd always owned up properly too, whatever it was. It all got too much that day.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: It wasn't just us two who scarpered once the patrol started beating. It's ten or so of us, all summoned that day by the army. We all ran at once.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: But if the army wants someone, there's no escaping it. That lot won't change their tune just because someone's word says they're innocent.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: You ended up killing someone?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Yeah, we did two of 'em in. Got one straight off with a hoe while they weren't on guard, the other we laid low in the whole scuffle.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Shame we let the third one do a runner, or else the army'd never know about what we did.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Hey! We wouldn't be in such a miserable spot if we'd had one night more of a head start.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...Fergal, you think we could... give ourselves up to them? I could do it alone, even. Just can't stand these days on the run anymore.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: We didn't even nab the medicine. Oran's cut's just festering away, and he's... I can't take it, I can't.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: You drop the bloody idea. You think they'd make it easy on you?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Bloody wouldn't. They'd torture you first, crush your spirits.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Two minutes with someone like you, and they'd get everything about us pouring out.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Look. We've got no meds. Torture by sickness, that's torture all the same, yeah?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Are you—short of medicine?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Haha... we were sent out to rustle up some more, I'll say. They're waiting for us, a decent ways back somewhere.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: We were here planning to buy it, honest.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: But we knew in our heads, all the shops'd shut the moment lights-out sounded. We'd never make it in time beforehand.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: So we got a rough idea of when the patrol changes shifts, er, and we smashed through a shop window... I thought they wouldn't notice around about then.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...God.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...You? Guessing you're from the city. What got you out in this desolate a place?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...I'm searching for some things.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Do you—know about 'Dublinn'?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Yes, I understand.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I have some—antihemorrhagics and bandages on me, actually.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Mr. Fionn, I saw you were hurt... we should sort that out.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh, you noticed? It's nothing big, really...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: But—if you're willing to share a bit of medicals with me, that'd be fair play.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Our mates are hurt far worse. I'd bring 'em to them, if that's okay.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Er, they got bit by gloompincers.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: In that case, I can go with you...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: That way! We have footprints in the mud, leading that way!
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: It's the Tara rabble behind the arson! They're around here, no doubt!
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: —Q-Quick, hide!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: It's... it's a whole unit, half a dozen people, they're shining their torches this way!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Quick, bend down, come this way! It's solid ground here!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: It's alright... those soldiers won't dare to move too fast through the marsh.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: —Shh.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (Fionn, I can hear your teeth chattering!)
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: A torch flashes over them.
Reed grips her spear tight, the metal warming, hotter and hotter.
Well, that's shite! How come you lot get torches?! Pisses me off just seeing you!
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier?

attributes.content: Dublinn?!
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: Get her! She's got info, no doubt!
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: Get me? You're codding me!
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier?

attributes.content: Peuch! What're you slinging mud for?
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: Ugh—
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: Come on, Fionn, we've got to help her! Don't be a coward!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Alright, alright, okay...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Urgh—!
attributes.name: Patrol Member

attributes.content: Hah, couple of fresh boys don't take much to sort out.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier?

attributes.content: Hey, Fionn, Fergal! You made a right hames here, didn't you? Would've kicked the bucket if I didn't come looking, no?
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier?

attributes.content: No, yeah. Saved our skins. All thanks to you.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I told you, see, all this smashing and looting business might be beyond me...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Wait, what are you doing, Selmon? It's enough to knock them out. You're going to kill them all?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Aren't we going to be more guilty for that?!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Same difference! It doesn't matter how guilty if they're after a Taran—you get taken in, you're not coming out alive.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: *sigh* It makes a difference in my head.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Coward. You watch, I'm gonna do all these Victorian bastards right and—
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Stop. Don't do that.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: And who do you think you are?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Hah, what's the staring for? Gonna be a tattletale? Just you try.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Tattle? No, you're not even part of Dublinn. Why are you... dressed like that?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Why are you copying the Spectre Force's methods?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: —And on what basis do you claim that? You some Dublinn know-it-all?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Er, calm, now, Selmon.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: She's just a doctor. She was doing a runner with us just now...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...I think she's a good soul. I told her all about us.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Right, um, doctor... what you said about taking a look at our wounded, is that still valid?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Selmon, honest, you need to cool it... We mucked it all up. We didn't get the medicine. This kind doctor says she can help us, so that's all we can rely on now.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Tch, leave me out of this. Seems this doctor here recognizes my clothes.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: ...I'm sorry, I'm not a doctor.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But I still want—to try and help you.
attributes.name: Reed
